model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant about the DIALOGUE CONTEXT, enabling the Co-workers A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I feel so grateful to have a boss who is always so supportive of me.
Co-workers B: That's amazing to hear. Having a supportive boss can make all the difference in how you feel about your job.
Co-workers A: Definitely. It makes me feel secure in my position and motivated to do my best work.
Co-workers B: It's great to have that kind of positive reinforcement. Do you remember when we were working on that movie together and you were feeling really frustrated? 

MEMORY 1:
1. [Both Co-worker A and Co-worker B feel that their collaboration brought out the best in each other during the shoot.] - (React) - [Co-worker A and Co-worker B have a strong bond and mutual respect for each other's talents.]
2. [Co-worker A and Co-worker B are excited about working on future projects together and even starting their own production company someday.] - (Changed) - [Co-worker A and Co-worker B are optimistic about their creative futures and are considering entrepreneurship.]
3. [Co-worker A and Co-worker B met on a movie set and are now good friends.] - (React) - [Co-worker A values the friendship and growth they've experienced with Co-worker B.]

MEMORY 2:
User Description: Co-workers B is a director with no specific personal information available such as age, birthday, gender, height, weight, zodiac sign, Chinese zodiac sign, hometown, occupation, employer, education, or location. Their relationship status is also undisclosed.

Relationship Description: Co-workers A and Co-workers B met on set and developed a good friendship. Despite initial intimidation, Co-workers A realized that Co-workers B is down-to-earth and easy to work with. They brought out the best in each other during the shoot, collaborated to make the movie successful, and are excited about future projects, possibly starting their own production company.

Event Description: Co-workers A blew up a rabbit with a stick of dynamite, which caused anger and frustration. Co-workers B questioned this action and advised Co-workers A to talk to the director about easing up on the schedule. Co-workers A acknowledged their mistake, felt bad, and thanked Co-workers B for the support and reminder to learn from mistakes. Additionally, Co-workers A saw a spider on the way to work and freaked out, revealing a childhood fear of spiders. Co-workers B suggested facing this fear as part of the process of dealing with frustrations. Co-workers A also surprised Co-workers B with their jewelry making talent, reflecting on personal growth and progress.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: MEMORY 1 provides a more relevant and concise background that shows both Co-workers A and B have a positive and supportive relationship, resulting in successful collaborations, which directly aligns with the DIALOGUE CONTEXT where A is discussing feeling supported and motivated. MEMORY 2, while detailed, includes several unrelated events that do not directly support the discussion about having a supportive boss or feeling secure and motivated at work. 

Choice: 1
